column4: hi everyone, i bought a UMPC call Wibrain I1, and i try to install ubuntu on it with wubi.exe, but fail , when after install and restart the computer into DOS mode , it directly computer poweroff , why ? is the factory setting not allow user to use DOS mode or the ATOM processor cannot install Unbuntu with this way ?
ok wubi is  not that good a way to insatll  Ubuntu, and it seems you have some computer issues
have you tried a Ubuntu Live CD on there?
is that a old computer you bought?  and DOS mode????????   do you mean recovery mode in Windows?
, hi , no , i bought a very cute UMPC , is a very very mini computer , palm computer , and didnt have cdrom/dvdrom
which OS is on it?
ok a netbook?
oh... similar ,since it was also using atom processor
you went into DOS mode and the computer turns off???????
how much  RAM?   1GB?
and the computer shoudn't just turn off ever, unless bad hardware

never ~ even i install a Ghost it was also unable to run in DOS mode, i only can use the GHOST under windows, yes is RAM 1GB , thats why i think it was the factory set something to denine user to get into DOS mode

ok  you got some problems with your lap top.  it's hardware or windows issues.   that would be why wubi didn't work either.  if you can get those issues sorted out try a Ubuntu Live CD after md5suming it and install from that
Go to #windows  for help with  that
no good putting Ubuntu on,  unless  you know the hardware is fine, and that Windows works good to
you told me the computer just turned itself off?
a computer should never just turn itself off
that could mean your hardware is bad
or it was just Windows being stupid
yep ok well not here for that one, but yes #windows
and there's  #hardware
thank bro
then later on when you download an Ubuntu ISO,  you sould md5sum it before burning to a CD
